identificationModule.briefTitle: Androgen Effects on the Reproductive Neuroendocrine Axis
identificationModule.officialTitle: Androgen Effects on the Reproductive Neuroendocrine Axis

collaborators.name: Eunice Kennedy Shriver National Institute of Child Health and Human Development (NICHD)

descriptionModule.briefSummary: This research study investigates whether male-level exogenous androgens inhibit the reproductive neuroendocrine axis in otherwise healthy (non-PCOS) females.
descriptionModule.detailedDescription: Testosterone Replacement Therapy (TRT) is the mainstay of gender affirming care for transgender men (TGM) who have male gender identity after female sex assignment at birth. TGM receiving TRT over time exhibit irregular menstrual bleeding, however, the mechanism of menstrual disruption is unknown. Therefore, the investigators propose to evaluate the effect of chronic testosterone (T) exposure on ovarian hormones and pituitary gonadotropin release that determines menstrual cyclicity. The investigators will conduct a detailed study of urinary and blood reproductive hormone secretion in TGM before and during TRT as well as in untreated cisgender female (CGF) control subjects who report female gender identity congruent with female sex assignment at birth. The investigators will also perform periodic clinical and ultrasonographic evaluations. Furthermore, the investigators will monitor menstrual cycles and reproductive hormones in TGM who make the personal decision to discontinue TRT, whether it is to pursue fertility or for other reasons.

armGroups.label: TGM initiating TRT
armGroups.description: Transgender men/non-binary/non-gender-conforming initiating testosterone replacement therapy
interventionNames: Drug: Testosterone Cypionate 50 MG/ML Injectable Solution

armGroups.label: TGM discontinuing TRT
armGroups.description: Transgender men/non-binary/non-gender-conforming discontinuing testosterone replacement therapy
interventionNames: Drug: Testosterone Cypionate 50 MG/ML Injectable Solution

armGroups.label: CGF control group
armGroups.description: Cisgender females serving as a control group

interventions.name: Testosterone Cypionate 50 MG/ML Injectable Solution
interventions.description:
Participants in the initiating group will receive weekly doses of testosterone for gender-affirming care.

Participants in the discontinuing group will receive testosterone during their first month of enrollment and then will cease receiving testosterone.

Participants in the discontinuing group will receive testosterone during their first month of enrollment and then will cease receiving testosterone.

primaryOutcomes.description: Evidence of Luteal Activity (ELA), as defined by a 3-fold increase in urinary pregnanediol glucuronide (PdG) level over baseline. Basal urinary PdG levels, normalized to urinary creatinine excretion, will be determined based upon the minimum daily PdG level detected per cycle or 4-wk interval. PdG will be measured via enzyme-linked immunosorbent assay (ELISA).
primaryOutcomes.timeFrame: Through study completion, an average of 7 months.

primaryOutcomes.description: Subjects will have baseline measurement of serum LH immediately followed by frequent blood sampling at 10-min intervals for 8 h. We will measure LH pulse frequency, the number of LH pulses per 8 hours.
primaryOutcomes.timeFrame: Through study completion, an average of 7 months.

primaryOutcomes.description: All subjects will complete a daily uterine bleeding log using REDCap®
primaryOutcomes.timeFrame: Through study completion, an average of 7 months.

secondaryOutcomes.description: Measurement of of serum FSH and LH levels, in IU/mL
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: Through study completion, an average of 7 months.

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Determination of serum FSH, AMH and testosterone
secondaryOutcomes.description: During testing of LH pulses (Primary outcome 2), FSH, AMH and testosterone levels will be measured hourly.
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: Through study completion, an average of 7 months.

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Determination of ovarian/uterine morphology: Presence of corpus luteum
secondaryOutcomes.description: TGN will undergo weekly ultrasound (US) following TRT initiation for confirmation of corpus lutes (CL) formation (Yes/No).
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: Through study completion, an average of 7 months.

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Determination of ovarian/uterine morphology: Thickness of endometrium
secondaryOutcomes.description: TGN will undergo weekly ultrasound (US) following TRT initiation to measure endometrial thickness (mm).
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: Through study completion, an average of 7 months.

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Determination of ovarian/uterine morphology: Ovarian astral follicle count.
secondaryOutcomes.description: TGN will undergo weekly ultrasound (US) following TRT initiation to measure astral follicle count (AFC).
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: Through study completion, an average of 7 months.

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Determination of ovarian/uterine morphology: volume of uterus and ovaries
secondaryOutcomes.description: TGN will undergo weekly ultrasound (US) following TRT initiation to measure volume of uterus and ovaries (mL).
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: Through study completion, an average of 7 months.

eligibilityModule.eligibilityCriteria:
Inclusion Criteria:

All

1. Provision of signed and dated informed consent form
2. Stated willingness to comply with all study procedures and availability for the duration of the study
3. Aged 18-35

   Transgender/Non-binary Group - Initiators
4. Plan to initiate testosterone therapy
5. History of regular menstrual cycles (every 24-35 days) at baseline, before beginning TRT

Transgender/Non-binary Group - Discontinuers 4. Plan to discontinue testosterone therapy 5. History of regular menstrual cycles (every 24-35 days) before beginning TRT

Cisgender Female Group 4. Having regular menstrual cycles (every 24-35 days)

Exclusion Criteria:

All

1. Pregnant
2. Incarcerated
3. Known cognitive impairment or institutionalized
4. Hemoglobin less than 11 gm/dl at screening evaluation
5. Weight less than 110 pounds
6. BMI \<18 or \>35
7. Current endocrine disease- including untreated thyroid abnormalities, pituitary or adrenal disease, polycystic ovary syndrome, or androgen producing tumor
8. Current or recent pregnancy within two months of study enrollment
9. Current or recent breast feeding within two months of study enrollment
10. Diabetes, or renal, liver, or heart disease
11. History of oophorectomy or hysterectomy
12. History of radiation or surgery involving brain structures
13. Currently taking any medications that may affect their reproductive hormones, such as contraceptive medications, androgens, estrogens, progestins, GnRH antagonists, GnRH agonists, insulinomimetics, and metformin.

    For TRT Initiation Group and Cisgender Female group:
14. History of prior testosterone therapy
eligibilityModule.genderDescription: Cisgender females Transgender males/non-binary/gender non-conforming either initiating or discontinuing testosterone replacement therapy
eligibilityModule.studyPopulation: Transgender men who are initiating or discontinuing gender-affirming testosterone replacement therapy as part of their medical care. The investigators will also study a control group of cisgender females who are not receiving testosterone.
